section.title: View
section.para:
The view resource is meant to provide the user a turn-key view that may be used as is throughout the application. The view provided will be setup with the following:
Majisti's application library views scripts
Majisti and MajistiX view helpers added to the pluginloader
ZendX JQuery view helpers added to the pluginloader
The application's library view helpers under APPLICATION_LIBRARY/views/helpers
The application's library scripts under APPLICATION_LIBRARY/views/scripts
The Zend_View registry key will be setup with that view
The doctype will be set to XHTML1_STRICT.
JQuery loaded according to the configuration.

example.title: Using JQuery Basic Usage
example.para: When in development environment, the JQuery URL used by default will be MAJISIT_JQUERY/jquery.js. The URL may be overriden in the resources configuration file by setting the variable below: resources.view.jquery.localPath = BASE_URL "/path/to/jquery.js" resources.view.jquery.ui.localPath = BASE_URL "/path/to/ui.js"

When in production environment, the JQuery URL should be set to the Google API's ajax library for better loading time (you know Google is in about the entire planet's cache don't you?). This provides significant performance gain and increased end-user happiness. Since Majisti strives to make developpers and end-users happy, the default production JQuery URL is already set to Google's JQuery library. No need to change anything.

If that does not make you happy enough, do not worry, you may change it by simply adding the JQuery's URL in the resources config file: resources.view.jquery.localPath = "http://www.example.com/jquery.js" resources.view.jquery.ui.localPath = "http://www.example.com/ui.js"
